org.cleartk.classifier.mallet
Class MalletCRFClassifier

java.lang.Object
  org.cleartk.classifier.SequentialClassifier_ImplBase<String,String,List<NameNumber>>
      org.cleartk.classifier.mallet.MalletCRFClassifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
SequentialClassifier<String>
public class MalletCRFClassifier
extends SequentialClassifier_ImplBase<String,String,List<NameNumber>>


Copyright (c) 2007-2008, Regents of the University of Colorado
All rights reserved.

Author:
Philip Ogren This classifier provides an interface to the Mallet Conditional Random Field (CRF) tagger. Annotators that use a sequential learner such as this one will need to support classification of a sequence of instances.

Method Detail

classifySequence

public List<String> classifySequence(List<List<Feature>> features)
                              throws CleartkException
This method classifies several instances at once

Parameters:
features - a list of lists of features - each list in the list represents one instance to be classified. The list should correspond to some logical sequence of instances to be classified (e.g. tokens in a sentence or lines in a document) that corresponds to the model that has been built for this classifier.
Returns:
a list of the classifications made.
Throws:
CleartkException

toStrings

private String[][] toStrings(List<List<Feature>> features)
                      throws CleartkException
Converts the features into a 2D string array that Mallet can use. The only thing mildly tricky about this method is that the length of each string array is one more than the size of each feature list - i.e. returnValues[0].length == features.get(0).size() + 1 where the last element in each string array is an empty string.

Parameters:
features - the features to be converted.
Returns:
a 2D string array that Mallet can use.
Throws:
CleartkException
